placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text:
Special thanks to Mr.Vimukthi and his team for making our stay memorable. 

We visited Sigiriya Village in the first week to celebrate my sister’s birthday . We had some foreign guests along . The rooms offered were superb , so spacious and very clean with the best surrounding. I loved the architecture done and most importantly the amazing staff who made sure everything was perfect. 
Thank you Krishantha and your amazing team for being there for us from the check in with a warm welcome and for arranging a beautiful surprise for my sister on her birthday . You took so much efforts in making a memorable birthday  celebration, so hats off to you Krishantha. 
Thanks to the housekeeping team too for decorating the room beautifully for her birthday. She was truly surprised and you guys were great .  Her birthday celebration was overlooking the sigiriya rock and it was splendid to have a cool backdrop unlike the usual cake cutting . So we are sooo happy for you and your team’s tremendous service .

Not forgetting the most talented chef in house ; Many thanks to you Chef Manjula for treating us to the fullest . We felt like home . He made sure we satisfied our cravings and made yummy dishes customized specially for our requests. The black pork curry was beyond our expectations. It was that delicious and he also arranged a beautiful yummy birthday cake with a short notice , which was not expected at all . Thank you sooo much for your great hospitality and for your kindness Chef Manjula . Meals were on point and the traditional lankan dishes were truly delicious . We highly recommend in trying the Sri Lankan dishes whenever you visit this property . 
Hats off to you and your team Chef ! 

Also we the best of the best spa session with Podi Manike and the boy ( sorry i don’t remember his name ) , the best therapist’s ever . Soo relaxing and so friendly . They too gave a great service . 
I would highly recommend this property to any couple or family getaways to enjoy some nature loving experience overlooking the sigiriya rock . Will defend come back !
title: Hospitality at its best !

text:
This hotel was fantastic, you feel like you’re in the middle of the jungle here. It has a lovely feel to it with super friendly staff who can’t do enough for you. 
If you are a light sleeper then might be worth taking earplugs as some of the wildlife can be noisy at night, not that that hindered us or impacted our feelings about the hotel. The beds were comfy, the rooms generously sized and most of all the food was excellent!! Huge selection and all very tasty. Stunning views over Sigiriya. Highly recommended!!!
title: Fab stay here! Highly recommended

roomTip:
This is a very good hotel with every facilities and yummy food.
And the rates also very reasonable.
text:
This was our first stay in this hotel.aThe welcoming procedures  were really amazing with fragrance wet cold towels and fresh raw mango juices. 
Very carm surrounding with lot of greenery. The bed was huge and very comfy. I l love the   tub there.
Furniture also very modern and  elegant. 
Hotel staff also very friendly and helpful. 
Specially I want to mention about the food.It was so yummy. 
We were on B/B basic.We ordered our dinner from the a la carte. The portions also really good.
Following  day breakfast  it had big spred both srilankan  and western dishes. It was really yum and bon appitite. Special thanks should go to their Executive chef MANJULA  PERERA  and his team for the amazing food.We really enjoyed 😉. 
You get a nice view of lions rock  Sigiriya. 
Pool also fairly big and clean
I highly recommend this hotel not only for the foreigners  but locals  as well.
Rates also affordable. 
Special regards  to Executive Chef MANJULA  PERERA. 
Mr & Mrs Nilanthi Perera.
title: Lovely  stay

text:
I saw the reviews earlier and given that most hotels were booked I got nervous reading that the rooms are dated. 

Having spent two nights there, I felt I wasted time being concerned of it's state. 
Yes it could do with updating, but it's not dirty by any means. Particularly with the price you pay. The hotel has brilliant food in a beautiful jungle like location ( saw lizards monkeys frogs and the pet ducks) and the best thing about this place is the staff. Everyone smiled and ensured that things were up to our satisfaction. 

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and would come again. The best memory by far is being sat by the pool and enjoying the lions rock. 

Special thanks to the young girl still in University on her placement Thilanka. You were kind and attentive which made this trip one to remember.
title: Will stay again

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text:
The location is fabulous, friendly staff, clean rooms and a pool view of Sigiriya Rock. 

This a relaxing place to end your day of sightseeing, enjoy a cold drink by the pool before dinner or heading out. Close to all the must see sites. 

I love how it’s 150m from the village stripe, full of everything a tourist might need and plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from. 

The hotel’s buffet offers great options for breakfast or dinner if you don’t feel like heading out. 

Recommend min of 2 nights- but if you are lucky enough to be travelling at a slower pace, min of 3 is better. Then you can do the sunrise or sunset walks on different days.
title: A relaxing oasis after a day of sightseeing.

The place is amazing, very peaceful and beautiful.   It has nice spacious rooms, a nice pool with the view and excellent restaurant, wish we dine there all of the time instead of city restaurants.  The staff were great and very attentive.  
would definitely stay there again!
title: I would stay there just for food

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text: A couple of friends and I stayed at Sigiriya Village Hotel for a few nights this August.  Our chalet was beautiful and so peaceful.  The entire property is a calm oasis.  That view of Sigiriya Fortress from the swimming pool was alone worth staying there.  The staff were very kind and eager to help with any request, and the hotel restaurant was the best meal we had in Sigiriya.  Cannot recommend this hotel enough.
title: Best hotel in Sigiriya

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text:
Checked in during the long weekend for a two night stay. Rooms were allocated by the time we arrived. Smooth check in. Rooms were clean n tidy. Kasun looked into our needs. Scrumptious food served at the restaurant. As usual Chef Manjula did his best and was ever obliging our requests. Stay was memorable. Friendly staff ever helpful. Special thanks to Dilhani for her service at the restaurant. 
A locker in the room to keep our valuables would've been better.
title: Memorable stay

text: One of The Best Hotel in Sigiriya. Excellent Service. Food was the ultimate. We stayed 2 nights triple bedroom on full board basis. 5000 LKR per night. Definitely worth paying. We loved staying here. I would recommend this hotel a 5 star. My 7 year old son still cries after leaving from this hotel. He loved it so much. Thank you Sigiriya Village hotel & team.

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text: The room and the main area of the hotel is lovely, very good value for money! Tharika was very welcoming and chatted to us during our stay! Lovely view of Sigirya rock from the hotel and the small tourist strip is 5min walking distance away with lovely option for food and drinks with the view of the rock! We only had breakfast here which had lots of variety to choose from and liked the fact that they have a fresh hopper and omelette station. Make sure to try the curd (Buffalo yogurt ) with kithul it was great! The hotel had a lovely calming atmosphere, would happily stay here again in the future!
title: Comfort and value for money

text: The hotel is quite old. It’s the same look and feel left when I last visited the place 19 years ago. The calmness is amazing in the hotel and surrounding area. Very peaceful. Staff are amazing. Food needs to improve on variety even though it is a small spread. The Sri Lankan menu in the buffet is always highly recommended. The hotel organized the safari and Sigiriya rock climbing journeys.

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text:
Had a lovely and relaxing stay at the Sigiriya village. We arrived extremely tired on the first night and Hemamali welcomed us with her beautiful smile and completed check in responsibilities very smoothly. 
During next day breakfast we were greeted by Tharika and her positive and professional attitude. Her positive energy is contagious. 💝
Thank you to the porters too who were kind enough to transport our luggages to our villa which was towards the end of the village. 
The pool staff member made sure to accomodate our request in placing the chairs to where we could see the rock. 
Breakfast buffet was beautiful. Only suggestion we would like to make is to have some eggs, sausages and hoppers ready made to beat hungry guests queuing up. 
We enjoyed the authentic Sri Lankan breakfast for sure. 
Our Ayurvedic spa experience with Podi Manike was exceptional as well. 
If we ever come back to visit Sri Lanka we have no hesitation in booking this beautiful hotel to add another experience to our travelling memories. 🙏
title: Beautiful stay in a nature friendly and people friendly resort

placeInfo: {'id': '447407', 'name': 'Sigiriya Village Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2110, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.9495, 'longitude': 80.7612, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d447407-Reviews-Sigiriya_Village_Hotel-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sigiriya-village.com/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 35, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 254, 'count4': 751, 'count5': 1013}}
text:
I recommend this hotel very much.
The atmosphere is relax and calm. Inside the hotel is very huge and each room is like a house. My room is quite far from the reception but i could enjoy walking in the hotel because it was very pretty.
Buffet had many varieties. A few kinds of curries, many kind of breads, veges, pasta, and so on.
I am a vegetarian but still have a lot of my foods.
The best staff was Tahrika. She was still in her internship but she was very friendly. Her smile made me smile.
She also showed me which foods were vegetarian and non spicy. She was very sweet.
Other staffs were also very kind and the great hospitality.
title: The relax stay in Sigiriya

text: Our extended family of 8 stayed here for three days in three rooms in July 2024. The hotel had a nice feel to it with two or three rooms clustered together among large trees and shrubs. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms were large, very clean and well serviced. We had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant. There was a big selection on offer in the buffet and it was tasty. Every night we were there, there a singer or a group playing. The kids loved this. We would love to stay here again.
title: Lovely hotel

ownerResponse:
{'id': '977852772', 'text': '
Hello Anuradha, 

Thank you for having selected to stay at Water Garden Sigiriya. I am writing to express our sincere apologies for the disappointing experience you encountered during your recent stay with us, particularly on what should have been a memorable evening for your honeymoon celebration. We deeply regret the inconvenience caused by a group of guests who had booked multiple villas under our credit card promotion offer. While we strive to treat all guests fairly, we acknowledge that the behavior of this particular group fell short of our usual standards. We understand that the short duration of the noise disturbance affected your romantic dinner celebration and for that we offer our heartfelt apologies.

The party in question had booked 5 villas using the credit card promotion offer that was introduced in September. As an ethical hotel operator we do not discriminate customers who want to book and stay with us, yet I strongly agree with you that the caliber and some behaviours demonstrated by the group in question do not reflect the usual clientele that the hotel attracts. They were informed twice by Duminda, our Restaurant Manager to turn the music down and as they did not pay heed to his request, he called me to assist. 
I immediately went to the poolside and observed that while the majority of the party were in the pool, a few of them were having a drink by the pool bar area. There was a blue tooth speaker which they had brought along and some Sinhala music (not karaoke) was being played. I immediately informed them that we normally do not allow for such activities to be conducted on our premises and asked for the music to be turned down very low. The group were not pleased with my request but did comply. I also asked them to move the direction of the speaker to face the opposite direction (away from pool) and ensured that the music was turned down low. I went back to the restaurant entrance to check if the sound of the music was low and it was. I continued to stay around the pool bar area for app 30 minutes to ensure that they did not turn the volume up again. It needs to be noted that almost all Sri Lankan guests do enjoy using the pool after sunset hours, hence we are flexible with our pool usage hours for all our resident guests as we do not entertain non-resident guests for reasons of privacy and safety. However, I do agree that in these instances we need to be more mindful of the impact on honeymoon couples like yourselves and other inhouse guests dining by the poolside. 
 
I also wish to take this opportunity to assure you and all others that the group involved was not comprised of friends or acquaintances of either mine or any member of the management team of the hotel. We treat all guests equally and do not offer preferential treatment to anyone.  With regard to the steam and sauna facilities, we understand your surprise about the additional charge. We usually do not charge if the said facilities are used in conjunction with a treatment and my apologies that this policy may differ from what you have experienced elsewhere. However, we appreciate your feedback and will consider reviewing this policy in the future.

Once again, we sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations during what should have been a joyous occasion. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we will take immediate action to prevent such incidents in the future.

We hope you will give us another opportunity to serve you better and create unforgettable memories during your stay with us. Please do not hesitate to contact me personally if you need anything further.

Congratulations once again on your marriage, and we wish you many years of happiness together.

Sincerely 
David de Silva
General Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-30', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
We were there for our honeymoon,during which there was card promotion that had attracted some hooligans who played loud music in public areas and not behaving appropriately . The management did not do anything about it despite the several times  I complained to the staff that it’s interrupting my fist dinner after I got married  since these hooligans were having a loud karaoke session near the main pool using their own Speaker . My table was set up near the pool . It was very surprising as to why the hotel even allowed the usage of the pool to these hooligans at night after closing hours. It came to my understanding the above group was known to the general manager of the hotel hence a special allowance for his friends were given to behave in such a manner regardless the disturbance caused to other inhouse guests.

The service is stiff . We need to pay additionaly 10,000 rupees in order to use the steam and sauna to my suprise this is not the case in any hotel I go in the world  . The standards have dropped a lot since 2017 when I first visited there. I will not recommend anyone to go to water  garden Sigiriya .
title: Terrible honeymoon experience at water garden sigiriya

roomTip: Book your visit to Lion Rock early to avoid the crowds
text: What a fabulous place to start our Sri Lanka tour. 2 nights here was perfect. Amazingly large pool villa with comfortable bed. 10/10  for customer service. Had 2 massages which were great value very effective. The food was great and enjoyed the Arrack tasting session. Loved the 25m outdoor pool with an amazing setting. Close to Lion Rock and Minneriya National park. Would highly recommend to others.
title: Perfect start to Sri Lanka!

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: We went on the 21st September 2024 and it was very quiet but perfect for us
text:
This was the best holiday my husband and I have ever had it was perfect from start to finish. We were treated like royalty off the staff nothing was too much trouble for any of them. The housekeeping were brilliant, the waiters, the reception, the bar staff, the chefs, the food was 5 star it was beautiful. There are not enough words to tell you about our overall experience at this place, the wildlife was spectacular, everything from crocodiles to peacocks, owls, beautiful birds including birds of prey, you didn’t really need to go anywhere although we did have many trips but came back to the water gardens each day. We stayed there for 14 nights and it was the best thing we ever did. If you’re not sure where to stay we can’t recommend this place enough. I have terminal cancer and if I can visit there again before I’m too ill we definitely will. 
Thankyou to you all for such a wonderful experience with beautiful Sri Lankan people you really are something else ❤️
title: Beautiful and memorable experience

ownerResponse:
{'id': '973717963', 'text': 'Hello Sue, 

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your wonderful feedback about your recent stay with us! We are absolutely thrilled to hear that our accommodations felt like your own private apartment and that you enjoyed our service, cuisine on offer and found all our staff to be fabulous. Our butler service and buggy rides to the restaurant are some of our favorite perks too!

With regards to the free bicycle tour, we actually keep our bikes available at the front desk for all guests to use whenever they would like to. It seems we might not have communicated this clearly enough during your stay, and for that, we apologize. As for the complimentary 15-minute neck, back, and shoulder massage, we did inform you upon check-in that you would need to book this directly through our spa team. We understand that you had 2 back to back days of tours and that perhaps time was of the essence. We are truly sorry they were not utilized during your stay. 

Once again, thank you for choosing us and for sharing your experience. We hope to welcome you back soon!

With sunny regards from Sigiriya

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: Get a room with a view of Siguriya.
text: A very good hotel with excellent staff and super service.  If we are in the area we will surely go back.  Thamidu was extremely attentive.  Dhananjaya, our butler, was always on hand and extremely helpful.  If you stay here ask for a room with a view of Siguriya - there are three or four with uninterrupted views, and you then have the joy of watching the snakes of people climb the rock in the distance across fields with lots of bird life and the occasional elephant.  The hotel grounds have Monitor Lizards, IBIS, Kingfishers, storks etc, and.....crocodiles.
title: Great hotel near Siguriya

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: The climb to the top of Lion Rock can seem imposing but taken slowly you will be on top before you know it and the experience is worth it!!
text:
Upon entering the grounds of the Water Garden Sigiriya you are swept away by the size and scope of the facility. Passing lakes with small islands you arrive at the front lobby and look out on a perfect layout of comfort and beauty, Spa, restaurant, infinity pool and a pathway leading to the tastefully stylish bungalows.  In the background is Lion Rock a fortress/ Palace built around 500AD. 
The rooms are stunning. Some with their own plunge pools and all designed with a high taste level and modern comforts. 
The service was impeccable and the food was of the highest quality from International dishes to Sri Lankan classics.  
There are some must do's when staying here, one is,  take a jeep safari to see the local wild elephant herds and the other is to climb to the top of Lion Rock! It's about 1,200 steps to the top and well worth the effort!
title: Water Garden Sigiriya a 10 out of 10

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: It’s best to preorder your meals as this speeds up the service time in restaurant.
text: We had a very comfortable and enjoyable stay at Water Garden. The two bedroom villa had plenty of space with its own pool. The food was tasty and was from a set menu, was adapted to suit the guest. The staff were very attentive though did not intrude on privacy. The view from the grounds was fabulous with the Sigiriya rock in the distance. The spa was also delightful where I enjoyed a relaxing massage. Something that stood out in this property is the attention to nature and serene surroundings. Staying in the villas is expensive, but you do get a great experience. A butler assigned to each of the villas is available for the guests. This was our second stay at Water Garden. Would definitely recommend if you are after quiet serenity, privacy and exploring the rock and Minneriya nature reserve.
title: A luxurious and comfortable stay

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
Our first stop in Sri Lanka was at Water Garden Sigiriya and our stay was absolutely lovely for many reasons and would highly recommend it. 

The views are stunning and the setting of the hotel is beautiful, surrounded by peacocks, monkeys and the odd crocodile 😉. 

The rooms were kept incredibly clean and Pradeep our house keeper was amazing! He always went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and would come to drop off little presents (biscuits, fudge and coconut bites). Our stay would not have been the same without his huge smile and brilliant service. 

The food and drinks were delicious, our servers were Sampath and Dilshan. Again, always made us feel comfortable and we’re there for anything we needed. The cocktails made by Deepak, were also special and we even took part in an Arrack tasting session. 

As a whole we had an incredible time here and out of all the hotels we stayed in throughout our trip in Sri Lanka, Water Garden Sigiriya has a special place in our heart. Mainly down to the incredible staff mentioned above who took amazing care of us. Not to forget Nipun our who gave us a warm welcome and was always on hand for any questions we had! 

Thank you to you all! 

Milan.
title: Absolutely Incredible! Staff are 5 star!

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
We would like to thank Water Garden Sigiriya for hosting Unforgettable Sri Lanka for High Tea. It was truly spectacular and an experience that will stay with us always.

Unforgettable Sri Lanka has visited Water Garden Sigiriya on previous occasions and it never disappoints. As soon as you arrive and see Sigiriya Rock, you will be awestruck. The grounds are peaceful and the accommodation is spectacular!
title: An Alice in Wonderland High Tea Experience

ownerResponse:
{'id': '967644379', 'text': 'Hello Aebeach, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts about your recent stay with us. We are thrilled to hear that you found our property beautiful and serene, and that our staff were friendly and accommodating. We are particularly glad you enjoyed the pool area and appreciated the spaciousness of our standard villas.

We are sorry to hear that our Western menu options did not quite meet your expectations. We take all feedback seriously and would have been happy to address any food concerns during your stay if they had been communicated to us. Our culinary team works hard to innovate and please a wide variety of palates.

text:
I went with my family to the Water Gardens Sigirya hotel during the August holidays. We spent two nights at the hotel. You are greeted at the lobby by the General Manager and the front house lady, who is properly groomed. The service at hotel, is excellent.

First day of the trip, the food tasted pretty average, but after complaining to head chef, the food was tasty and we had a wider range to choose without having to select from a set menu.

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: Get your own plunge pool, it is worth it.
text:
We enjoyed an amazing pool villa in magnificent surroundings! 
Accomodation, staff and facilities all 5 star. We celebrated our 30 year wedding anniversary during this trip. All staff, including personal butler Shashi worked hard to enhance our stay with lovely personal touches, such as a pair of pearl earrings to symbolise the anniversary, a lovely hand made card, wine, cake and many other kind and considerate personal touches. 
Whilst we had our own pool, we also visited the great hotel pool, conveniently located next to a wonderful hotel bar. The upstairs of the open air bar has a balcony where you can have an incredible view of sunset with an ancient temple as a backdrop, simply stunning! 
Our travel agent selected this hotel out of many. The hotel is close to famous temples and national parks and has all the amenities you could ask for, yoga, gym, great food and so much more.
However, the main reason for this part of our stay was to experience "The Gathering" which is large herds of elephants in the wild. This was a bucket list item and did not disappoint. We saw hundreds of elephants, with mothers feeding babies and rare elephant with tusks. We choose to have our own guide and vehicle. We arrived in the afternoon around 3.30pm as the elephants were waking up and ready to feed.
This is a "must do" journey for animal lovers. 
The temples are also awesome, but for me the elephants were everything. 
There is so much to do in this area. Whilst we stayed two nights, three would of been better as we would have had more time to enjoy the hotels facilities including more time in our amazing villa. 
A huge thanks to all the staff at Water Garden Sigiriya, we had an amazing stay and hope to return one day.
title: When you love elephants, temples and luxurious accom!

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
This hotel is the best hotel we have stayed in Sri Lanka. The exceptional hospitality provided by David and his team transformed our three-night stay into an unforgettable holiday.

Our chalet was impeccably clean and the private plunge pool was a luxurious touch. 

The hotel's stunning design offers breathtaking views of Sigiriya Rock. The surrounding nature is equally impressive, with a variety of birdlife, including peacocks, and the residents of the lake - four harmless mugger crocodiles. 

The culinary experience was outstanding. The Sri Lankan dishes were some of the best I've tasted, a testament to the chef's skill and passion. 
The chef regularly interacts with guests to ensure their satisfaction, and we also had the pleasure of meeting General Manager David on several occasions. His dedication to guest well-being is evident in his frequent interactions with visitors, a hallmark of a truly exceptional hotel.
Every member of the staff, from housekeeping, butlers, restaurant staff  to the front desk, contributed to the overall warm and friendly atmosphere. Customer service in this hotel is exemplary. 
We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sri Lanka. It's a perfect blend of luxury, nature, and unparalleled hospitality.

We were disappointed to leave after 3 nights, next time we will stay longer. 
Big thank you to David and team for making our stay memorable, we will be back.
title: Best hotel in Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
We stayed in a duplex two-bedrooms villa with plunge pool and sun lounger deck, which was perfect for our family with two adult kids and a teen - extra bed put in large ground floor twin room. This had a large bathroom with separate shower and bath.

Superking upstairs with balcony and large windows with view across the water garden and plunge pool. Large bathroom with outside bath on the separate bathroom balcony.

Terrace upstairs with table for dining. Room service great to get after a late arrival and served here.

Good sized living room with some satellite tv and a mini bar.

The restaurant served a mixture of Sri Lankan and western food, all was delicious and lots of choice. All menus were a la carte.

The complex is set in 38 acres so some villas are a way from the facilities but you can call a golf buggy to take you to the very large outside pool, bar, restaurant, spa and yoga place.

Only bad point was a drains smell that came up into our lower bedroom and carried across to one side of the outside restaurant seating. You could sit inside to escape or at the front outside.

All staff very friendly and ready to chat about Sri Lanka.

We spotted a crocodile in one of the ponds too! 😜
title: Bird watching oasis near Sirigiya Rock.

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text: What a breathtaking place to stay. Nothing was too much trouble for them to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. When we arrived we were exhausted from an overnight flight and long transfer but we were pampered from the moment we arrived. We receive a lovely head and shoulders complimentary massage on arrival which was delightful. Our accommodation, the two bed villa with terrace was, we all agreed, the nicest accommodation we had stayed in during our three week trip of India and Sri Lanka. They arranged the bar to stay open at 2am for us to watch the England euros semi final. The ladies in the spa were so lovely and the treatments were great. The setting of the hotel was stunning and words can’t really do it justice.
title: Breathtaking setting and excellent hospitality from start to finish!

text:
We have just returned from a fantastic trip around Sri Lanka and the whole family agreed that The Water Gardens was the best hotel we stayed in not only in Sri Lanka but we would put in right up there with the very best hotels we have stayed in around the world and definitely one of the most relaxing. placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text: This has to be the best hotel we have ever stayed at, from the moment we arrived until when we left it was like being in paradise. The welcoming and complimentary massages set the bar high and it was maintained throughout our stay. Firstly the grounds are so well maintained (and with over 135 staff they are constantly refined and perfected!) and a joy to wander around with many peacocks, beautiful fish and even a crocodile basking on an island in the lake. The butlers were exceptional with a big thank you to Sashi for all his help particularly when our daughter was sick to arrange a doctor and also for all of the restaurant food to be provided at our room. The food was exceptional and better than anything else we had sampled not just in Sri Lanka but possibly ever. Even our “selective” children relished the breakfast and dinner time. Huge thanks to the executive chef and all of the restaurant staff for exceptional service - highly recommend the rotti with curry and dahl for breakfast and the curry and rice for dinner which has no less than 12 side dishes that were all amazing. The scallops were also some of the best my wife and I have ever tasted. Ricky the wellbeing expert led amazing daily yoga sessions that we all enjoyed and learnt new techniques. Finally the rooms themselves were unbelievable with exceptionally tasteful design and high quality accessories including some great Nikon binoculars that came in very handy for our safari and the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. If I could live here I would. We will be back!
title: Paradise

text: The most stunning property we have stayed at in Sri Lanka. From the moment our driver pulled into the entrance you could sense how special the place was.  The staff were lovely and couldn’t do enough for you. We stayed in a room with a private pool which I would highly recommend. The room was fantastic and was large and spacious and felt very luxurious. There is a beautiful view of The Sigiriya Rock from the hotel grounds. Lots of animals to see in the grounds including monkeys, birds and even crocodiles!! We enjoyed a bicycle ride whilst we were there and a lovely treatment in the Spa. We will certainly return one day!
title: Wow, wow, wow!!

roomTip: Cancel any plans and stay at the hotel
text:
One of the most beautiful places we have ever been to. We went to celebrate my partners' birthday, and arriving there felt like a miracle. The property is uniquely located inside the park, with unique birds on its territory. The staff is super nice. It's a shame I don't remember the lady at reception's name; she was exceptionally nice and professional, helping with all sorts of requests.

Should I mention that you get a complimentary welcome shoulder massage upon arrival? Paradise! Even though the staff did not know we would come to dinner, they prepared a cake for the birthday. So sweet!

Thank you to the whole team for taking care of guests and maintaining the territory. Sigiriya Rock is just a 15-minute drive from the hotel, by the way.
title: A Magical Retreat: Celebrating a Birthday

text:
We had a magical stay at the Water Garden Villa hotel, the hotel has stunning views of Lion's Rock in Sigiriya. 

The service was spectacular, and the tranquil ambience, surrounded by peacocks and birds, made it a lovely experience. It was hard to leave the hotel with such a peaceful atmosphere and the joy of bird watching from our villa and just walking around the hotels premises. 

Special thanks to our butler who was assigned to us, Diland, who was incredibly helpful, always ready to pick us up in a golf car to the restaurant or spa whenever we required . 

We highly recommend this place for a serene and unforgettable stay!
title: Marvelous views and ambience !

ownerResponse:
{'id': '957623922', 'text': 'Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experiences during your recent stay at our hotel. We greatly value your feedback as it allows us to understand better how we can enhance our services and facilities to meet and exceed guest expectations.

We were disheartened to learn about the issues you encountered regarding the lack of water around your villa and the challenges with room service. Please accept our sincerest apologies for these shortcomings. As you have very correctly pointed out, April is indeed the hottest month of the year in sunny Sri Lanka and due to a prolonged drought, most of the water ways, lakes and ponds that are synonymous with Water Garden Sigiriya, tend to dry up until the rains arrive. Rest assured, we will investigate these matters thoroughly and take necessary actions to prevent such occurrences in the future.

Regarding the pool area, we acknowledge your concern about the lack of shade, especially considering the high temperatures in April. We will review our current arrangements and explore options to provide adequate shade for guests who prefer cooler environments. We do apologize for not meeting your expectations in this regard.

On a more positive note, we are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your spa experience and the cuisine on offer. These aspects of your stay highlight the areas where we excel, and we are committed to maintaining and improving these services. Please rest assured that your feedback has been taken very seriously, and we are implementing measures to address the issues you have raised. We sincerely hope that you will give us another opportunity to demonstrate our commitment to providing exceptional hospitality.

Once again, thank you for bringing these matters to our attention. We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the future, where we hope to offer you an experience that truly reflects our dedication to excellence.

With sunny regards from Sigiriya
David & the team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-01', 'responder': 'David de Silva', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text:
On first arrival the view and reception is incredible. Unfortunately due to the lack of rain our villa was actually over a dried mud bed and not water and the outside had the smell of stagnant water. Our butler was delightful but due to heat and an early start we decided to have room service. It took over 24hrs for these plates to be cleared from outside our room and not before the insects stepped in. Room service seemed to think it was the restaurants responsibility - eventually our butler took them away but not what you expect from a 5* hotel. 
Equally the pool had been created with an incredible view but zero shade and as April is the hottest month it was impossible to use and extremely hot!
The spa was a lovely experience and the food was good but I would be loathed to recommend this hotel for the price per night.
title: Overpriced and underwhelming.

text: We had an amazing trip at the Water Gardens. We loved our spacious villa where we could take a dip in the plunge pool and watch a film. ownerResponse:
{'id': '959736005', 'text': "Dear Guest, 

We are absolutely thrilled to receive such a glowing review from you! It truly warms our hearts to know that you found our property to be magnificent in every aspect. Your words about the stunning setting, spacious accommodations, and the exceptional service provided by our staff, particularly mentioning Chathumini, are incredibly heartening.

Your appreciation for the natural beauty surrounding Sigiriya Rock, the unique amenities like the golf carts and the up-to-date coffee machine, and the thoughtful touches such as local delicacies and ample provisions, are all highlights that we take immense pride in offering our guests. We are equally pleased to hear that you enjoyed the wildlife sightings and the overall ambiance of relaxation and luxury that our property aims to provide.

We appreciate your balanced feedback regarding areas for improvement, such as the internet connectivity, the condition of some showers, and the signage around the property. placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
roomTip: As indicated in above review.
text:
A 6 star property within a stunning setting, beautiful surroundings and large, spacious bedrooms with accompanying separate lounge room and large deck; more like an apartment. The cabins were well laid out, spacious and privately situated. The setting was stunning with beautiful relaxing surroundings in the shadow of Sigiriya Rock. How often would one see a crocodile swimming around before breakfast? The Golf Carts provided access to and from the accommodation. There was a specially appointed concierge for each group of cabins, available on WhatsApp. We were surrounded by an abundance of wildlife and bird life. The pool was great and the water felt silky to the skin.The outer and inner beauty of the staff, especially the hostess Chathumani, were very expressive. All staff were friendly and professional. Flexible meal service for our group of 15, including serving us as we remained seated.

It had an up-to-date coffee machine and the provision of local delicacies (coconut ice, milk toffee) rather than generic chocolates was appreciated. Good food was on offer and well presented. There were plenty of provisions and facilities in each room and the abundant of free bottled water was welcoming. The complex provides training and employment opportunities for locals living in the area, rather than bringing in staff from Colombo. 

Well designed hotel of traditional thatched roofs over metal to give finished raked ceilings.
Good seperate luggage storage between bathroom and bedroom. Good non skid tile insert in the shower.  Communicative butler service getting us anywhere in the resort during wet weather or whenever, and also coordinating the laundry service.

Only a few negatives - some showers leaked a lot of water into the bathroom; at times the Internet connection could be patchy; and some meat dishes, especially the lamb chops, were tough. In some rooms the light switches were confusing, making it difficult to find appropriate switches for operating the lighting. The hotel needs signage around the roads to show guest where they are.  Although the pathways were excellent and well swept, the signage all around the property was lacking to show guests where they were and where their Villas were located, especially at night.
title: This property was magnificent in every respect!

text: The villa was a delight, spacious and private, with a sun deck and dip pool. A few minutes walk along the bonk between ponds brought us to the restaurant, great at the start of the day, but after dinner in the dark a buggy ride back to the villa was better. roomTip: Try to stay more than just 2 days
text: I just recently traveled to Sri Lanka with my husband and son. Our entire stay was incredible and I loved every day and every minute of our trip. But Water Garden was easily the highlight. The grounds are the most beautiful hotel grounds I’ve ever seen. The water, the birds, the view of Sigiriya Rock, it’s magical. In the morning I sat on my balcony and watched the hundreds of birds flying and landing on the water and it was so peaceful and therapeutic for the soul. The food at the restaurant was fantastic, the service was top notch, the bartender was so kind and helpful. Our villa was absolutely beautifully appointed, if there wasn’t so much to see and visit in the area I would have been happy to just stay in the room. I loved our plunge pool too, it was so refreshing. I’ve traveled a lot in my life and have stayed many nice places but Water Garden was a real standout. I dream of returning soon.  Thank you so much to all the staff for the outstanding experience!
title: Magical Stay in Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text: This is a MUST place to stay. The stunning views and natural surroundings on their own makes the water gardens a dream destination. Add in the most friendliest staffing team and you have yourself a 5* experience. When entering the gardens, just past reception you are met with an infinity pool with beautiful views of the man made lakes and in the distance - Lions Rock. The water bungalows themselves are beautiful, positioned far enough away from one another so you have privacy, but surrounded in all the nature and natural surroundings. The thoughtfulness of the rooms - from the binoculars and bird watching books to the coffee and home made biscuits and evening treats made this place feel extra special. When it came to the wait staff, they couldn’t do enough. My fiancé and I are both vegetarian and the evening set menu didn’t have the greatest offerings for us, however the staff went out their way to accommodate us and we had the most amazing dining experience. You must try the Sri Lankan curry for dinner - 12 different dishes full of so much flavour and variety, and for breakfast the egg and coconut cream hoppers - sensational!! The staff couldn’t do enough to help us and any request wasn’t too much to accommodate.
title: Amazing stay, 5* service

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text: This man-made nature resort has done a great job integrating nature with modern luxury to provide a tranquilizing experience in one of the most scenic locations outside of the Sigiriya Fortress. Waking up to peacocks outside of your room window is a sight to remember and the management and staff seem to genuinely care for the wildlife from what we witnessed - really hope it stays that way and that they continue put sustainability as a priority! The staff were exceptional from the front desk to the room service to the amazing kitchen staff to the masseuses at the spa! The kitchen staff went above and beyond to accommodate and cater to the needs of our large family of 12, especially the children. The food was top-class and service was outstanding. Would love to visit again at some point in the future!
title: A tranquilizing experience!

placeInfo: {'id': '10416524', 'name': 'Water Garden Sigiriya', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1107, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.992871, 'longitude': 80.745834, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d10416524-Reviews-Water_Garden_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.watergardensigiriya.com', 'address': 'Indigaswewa, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigaswewa', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 68, 'count5': 1017}}
text: The property is very remote, on a very bumpy dirt road, but you can see Sigiriya Rock from the property. The separate villas are dotted around the water gardens and connected via dirt paths, there is a buggy to take you to the reception, pool and dining areas although sometimes we walked as it isn't very far. The villas are spacious with balconies and are spotless and the bed is so comfortable. There is one restaurant on site where you can have all meals, the food was delicious and large servings. The only negatives are the hotel is not anywhere near a village so you can't go for a stroll to explore Sigiriya village and therefore must eat and drink at the hotel. Also, the pool area is lovely but there is no shade (the umbrellas don't cover the whole of the sunlounges) so it gets very hot. There is a pool bar but the service was poor, if you could find someone to take your drink order, it took ages to then get the drinks. Overall, we loved our stay here though, it was very relaxing, the staff were lovely and the food was great.
title: Great view, relaxing

roomTip: If visiting Sigiriya Lion Rock, go first thing to avoid heat and crowds. Try and go on an elephant safari nearby as you’ll see lots!
text: We loved our stay at the Water Garden for two nights as part of our honeymoon and were sad to leave! We were given the most beautiful spacious villa with all amenities and more. The best thing about this hotel resort is the wildlife! Wild crocodiles were seen in the waters around our villa (don’t worry it’s safe!), countless peacocks, monkeys, wild elephants nearby and the biggest array of bird life. The sounds when you wake in the morning are stunning, it’s very peaceful and beautiful. The pool was fantastic and the restaurant very accommodating. Special mention to Nipun the butler who was very warm and friendly, so helpful. The buggies to transport around the property are a great idea, very handy and efficient. We wholeheartedly recommend Water Garden!
title: Stunning Honeymoon Destination

roomTip: Be mindful of geckos!
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a longer tour of Sri Lanka. This hotel had the best buffet out of all hotels we stayed at in the country - a wide variety of choices, very fresh and tasty food, and generally very nice atmosphere and ambience.
The room was also clean and tidy - though being a nature resort we had many geckos come in (something i dont enjoy but have learned to live with while in Asia!) but the staff was incredibly welcoming and looked after us really well. 
Hotel also had evening entertainment every night and was a great way to make us enjoy a drink sitting in the outdoor communal areas.
title: Memorable stay

text:
Great hotel with stunning views of Lion Rock. The staff were very attentive and made sure our visit was enjoyable 
The reception staff were great, in fact treated us like royalty.  
Our room was comfortable and the AC worked perfectly. 
We took a tuk tuk (500r) to the rock at 6 am and made it back in time for breakfast.  
We had the buffet 2 nights with a wide choice of things to eat, great value. 

I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Fabulous place to stay

roomTip: The local village is nice, the took tooks have a control on local transport. We tried to order an Uber which was a terrible experience
text:
Overall great experience everyone was very kind and the amenities were clean, food was really good great variety, big pool with a great view of the rock fortress. we had to ask for our room to be cleaned, and when it was done it was very rough.

Not necessarily a reflection on the hotel, but be mindful of the Sri Lankan tax system, the menu prices aren’t what you pay, you need to add at least 30% to the prices. It would be great if the hotel could add all the taxes on the menu upfront so tourists aren’t taken by surprise.
title: Good experience

placeInfo: {'id': '613020', 'name': 'Hotel Sigiriya', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3112, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.94992, 'longitude': 80.76336, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d613020-Reviews-Hotel_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.brownshotels.com/hotelsigiriya/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 42, 'count3': 295, 'count4': 1118, 'count5': 1606}}
roomTip: Don't book here.
text:
An OK location, but an absolutely appalling experience. Would not recommend anyone to stay here.

The air con in the room while working, kept spitting out water onto the floor.

The bicycles we rented were poorly maintained. Holes in the seat, broken gear shifter and the chain fell off while riding. I ended up with grease all over me fixing it and they still decided to charge me for the bike and the laundry.

The laundry we had done, they had decided to classify my t-shirts as full shirts even though they are clearly t-shirts.

The woman at the front desk gave the impression she had no interest in being here at all (this was across two days!), most of the staff were rude and abrupt.

The manager at the front desk had several charges on our bill that they could not produce receipts for. And rather than being polite and helpful they were rude and arrogant towards us. When asked for feedback at checkout we mentioned about the bike to which she shrugged her shoulders and said " normal". 

The only upside is the view (which can only be seen from one specific spot) and the buffet which was decent.

Don't bother booking this place, not worth the money or experience
title: Waste of money and time. An absolute disappointing place to stay. Poor customer service.

roomTip: Sri Lanka has so much to offer for a holiday. We are 75 and with a driver and preplanne holiday it was such a safe and enjoyable holiday. Excellent value too.
text:
We spent 2 weeks in Sri Lanka and had a superb trip with so many excellent experiences and such great service.
The only hiccup was hotel sigiriya were we got a grumpy waiter, numerous dishes on the menu  not available and to top it off the costs quoted on the food and beverage menu didn't include an extra 30% taxes ( they were in the fine print).
Watch out, this was the only place we stayed at that did this and it was somewhat sad that this experience was the only downside to such a memorable trip.
We highly recommend Sri Lanka as a holiday destination and would like to emphasise this was a one off for the entire trip.
Heaps of praise for travel local and best of Lanka they were fantastic.
title: Sri Lanka hotel Sigiriya

text:
Hotel Sigiriya just exceeded my expectations. The location and its view what attracts you the most closest to this hotel. Correct!! It’s called Hotel Sigiriya for a reason. And if you are a fan of Sri Lankan heritage, history and especially the Sigiriya Lions Rock, you MUST add this hotel to your bucket list. The view is to die for with a bonus of a telescope to view the rock from the hotel as if u are at the Lions rock premises itself. 
Furthermore, the highlight of this visit was the Village Tour organized by the hotel management and the presence of ATV bikes for a 20minute ride for a reasonable 20 USD. The hotel was also very accommodating to our needs and requests. There is evening High tea service available, a big pool and very popular Yaara Tea prepared by the staff..something you should check out if you visit this hotel. Even though our visit was a short stay, I am confident the rest of the hospitality and service would have been top notch!!
title: ATV Rides, Village Tour and the Infamous Lions Rock

placeInfo: {'id': '613020', 'name': 'Hotel Sigiriya', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3112, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.94992, 'longitude': 80.76336, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d613020-Reviews-Hotel_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.brownshotels.com/hotelsigiriya/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 42, 'count3': 295, 'count4': 1118, 'count5': 1606}}
text:
This is a good hotel but it is let down by the restaurant service. Whilst the food is good, the service in the restaurant is bad. If you don’t arrive soon after opening, you find that tables that have already been used have not been cleared and reset. It is rare that someone clears your empty plates away between courses, leaving them to stack up around you. It’s not nice to dine surrounded by tables covered in other people’s dirty plates. Empty dishes on the buffet are not refreshed so that your own choice is reduced. And trying to get someone to take a drinks order is hit and miss at best. 
Other staff in the hotel (poolside, reception, housekeeping) are friendly and helpful, but the restaurant waiting staff are not great. It would perhaps help if there was more of them. 
It’s a shame because the hotel itself is nice, with a lovely view of Lions Rock from the pool, and our rooms were a good size and clean. But although there are cafes within a few minutes walk which can be used for lunch, the dark road outside means that you will likely want to stay in the hotel for dinner in the evening and unfortunately that’s not a great experience.
title: Good hotel but with poor restaurant service

placeInfo: {'id': '613020', 'name': 'Hotel Sigiriya', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3112, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.94992, 'longitude': 80.76336, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d613020-Reviews-Hotel_Sigiriya-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.brownshotels.com/hotelsigiriya/', 'address': 'Hotel Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 42, 'count3': 295, 'count4': 1118, 'count5': 1606}}
roomTip: There are limited loungers avaliable at the pool area, so be sure to get one early (i'd say till 9 am).
text:
Amazing place, very friendly staff and everything's super clean. 
The rooms are big and comfortable. Renovated bathroom. The AC is working perfectly. Housekeeping every day with fresh water, towles and bathroom ameneties.
The pool area is great with a beautiful view at Sigirya. Pool towels are also avialiable. Limted loungers, first come first serve. 
The breakfest is very nice as well. A big selection of western and local cusine. The pastries leave room for improvement. And so does the coffee, it's really terrible (drip coffee with almost no taste). But that's just a small caveat.
In the evening theres a dinner buffet for 5,000 rupees, which is good, I'd recommend it once for your stay, then dining out. There's also live music every evening at the bar area, which has decently priced drinks (a big variety of coctails).
title: Amazing hotel for families and 'older couples'

placeInfo: {'id': '642314', 'name': 'Jetwing Vil Uyana', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2489, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.930625, 'longitude': 80.72074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d642314-Reviews-Jetwing_Vil_Uyana-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingviluyana/', 'address': 'Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rangirigama', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 30, 'count3': 75, 'count4': 343, 'count5': 2031}}
text:
I had the wonderful opportunity to spend 4 amazing nights at this beautiful hotel with my Mom, a couple of aunties and a cousin recently. 

From the time we arrived to the very last minute we were on the property, the service we received from our butler, Asoka, the guest experience lead, Buddhini and countless others was exceptional. We really felt very well taken care of. 

We occupied a couple of villas on the water and they were thoughtfully designed and well-equipped. We had some peacocks, monkeys, and many other bird species visit us just outside our deck every morning. I counted 9 different types of birds in just one hour one morning!!

I did some tours to Sigiriya, Pidurangala and an elephant safari while at the hotel and their naturalist, Yesitha, is a wealth of knowledge. If you’re going to any of these places, do yourself a favour and book Yesitha. 

We really enjoyed our time at this hotel and highly recommend it. A big thank you to all the wonderful people that made our stay truly memorable.
title: Unforgettable Luxury & Exceptional Service

text: Jetwing Vil Uyana is in a fantastic location. Just a short drive from several national parks where you can see elephants, monkeys, and wild cats it is also beautifully secluded. If you want to see wildlife at the hotel, there is even a resident croc, loris and plenty of large lizards. The hotel itself is filled with friendly and helpful staff who are more than happy to help with anything you may need and the food is truly top tier. Thanks for a fantastic stay!
title: Beautiful, secluded, and friendly

text:
My sister and I went on several guided tours with Yesitha and we truly had the best experiences! We enjoyed the Loris Night Trail, hiked up Sigiriya Rock to watch an unforgettable sunset, visited the stunning Dambulla Caves and went on a private jeep safari tour in Minneriya Park. The jeep safari was absolutely unforgettable—we were fortunate enough to see about 150 elephants, which was beyond magical!

What made these experiences truly exceptional was the time and care Yesitha took with us. His knowledge of Sri Lankan wildlife and culture is unparalleled, and he was ever so polite, well-spoken and passionate about his work. It was clear how much he loves what he does and that energy made every moment feel even more special.

If you're visiting Sri Lanka, we highly recommend booking these tours with Jetwing / Yesitha.  You won't be disappointed!
title: Ultimate guided experience!

text:
WOW!!  What an amazing hotel in a beautiful and stunning location.  We had a marshland dwelling with a plunge pool.  The room and location are even better in person  - the pictures don't do it justice.  We were very well looked after throughout our 4 night stay with our own personal butler, Ravindra.  Nothing was too much trouble and he certainly help make our stay most memorable for all the right reasons.   We celebrated our 25th Wedding Anniversary while we were at Vil Uyana and our table was set away from the restaurant overlooking the pool.  We were even given a bottle of wine and an anniversary cake made especially for us as my husband cannot eat chocolate.
During our stay, we got to do the Loris trail and we're lucky enough to see one. 
The hotel is in a great location for visiting Sigiriya Rock, the Dambulla Cave Temples and Minneriya National Park for the elephant gathering. 
A truly magical few days.
A big thank you to Ravindra, Anna and all the wonderful staff at Vil Uyana.
title: An anniversary to remember

text:
Lovely location with stunning lake complete with resident crocodile and herons. Close to nature location with a wonderful loris walk option. Very good restaurant with attentive staff.
The rooms are very large and well equipped but tired now and needing some maintenance. The Aircon in particular was a big issue for us, it was partially broken, forcing extreme cold air down onto the sleeping position which over three nights made us both ill.
title: Stunning lakeside location, with lovely large rooms, however some maintenance is required.

placeInfo: {'id': '642314', 'name': 'Jetwing Vil Uyana', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2489, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.930625, 'longitude': 80.72074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d642314-Reviews-Jetwing_Vil_Uyana-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingviluyana/', 'address': 'Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rangirigama', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 30, 'count3': 75, 'count4': 343, 'count5': 2031}}
roomTip: The pillows in the room were quite hard, and I had to ask for the softer pillows since I found it difficult to sleep on the hard pillow
text: Vil Uyana was a very nice hotel offering a different experience. The hotel is situated in the dry zone of Sri Lanka, but constructed with water and nature all around. We stayed in one of the Forest Dwelling with a Pool, which was great. Almost the whole ground floor was a very large bathroom with a shower, tub and two sinks etc. This opens up to your private pool, which has a lot of privacy. The top floor is a bedroom with an attached toilet, with very nice views of the surroundings. Our view included the restaurant and the lake and the evening and morning views were superb. The hotel has many electric carts which you can call anytime to get to anywhere. Each room has a personal butler as well. The hotel pool is very nice too, and has nice and warm water around noon for a refreshing swim. The bar menu and restaurant menu, food and drinks are all good. However, during the busy dinner time, its best to come a bit early to the restaurant since there could be a bit of a delay with the meals. We also went on a night safari, but unfortunately missed the fishing cats, although we saw some other animals such as elephants, owls and birds.
title: A very nice hotel and experience

title: Beautiful setting in the midst of nature.

text: We enjoyed our stay a lot in this very nice resort in the middle of nature. Extremely friendly people delivering great service, our personal butler Ravi was outstanding and a great support. You are really in the middle of nature, we saw monkeys, peacocks, a hunting fish otter, a crocodile, etc. We did the evening walk with the naturalist of the resort (very friendly & competent) and saw three Lories.  Very nice, modern and well maintained accomodation, our Paddy Dwelling with pool #153 was the best to my mind as it‘s located at the end of a walk way in the rice field, giving us good privacy.

placeInfo: {'id': '642314', 'name': 'Jetwing Vil Uyana', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2489, 'locationString': 'Sigiriya, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.930625, 'longitude': 80.72074, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304141-d642314-Reviews-Jetwing_Vil_Uyana-Sigiriya_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingviluyana/', 'address': 'Rangirigama, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Rangirigama', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Sigiriya', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 11, 'count2': 30, 'count3': 75, 'count4': 343, 'count5': 2031}}
text:
We had the most amazing stay at Vil Uyana. We cannot get over it. We stayed at the Forest villa with private pool and it was so dreamy. The whole property is like a dream. Beautifully landscaped while keeping the “wild” charm. There is a spa and gym which are both very nice, common pool area and a restaurant for all your meals which is also very nice. Usually, we are not a fan of hotel food, but this is not comparable. Every dish was excellent (tip: try to curry, it was life changing). 

We were so lucky to have Ravi as our butler. He was the absolute best and always there to greet us for every meal, make sure we were happy and enjoyed ourselves and made arrangements whenever we needed anything. He was extremely professional, had attention to detail, was kind and caring - a one of a kind. 

We also booked the safari through the hotel and were also lucky to have their naturalist Yessi join us. He was so knowledgeable, pleasant and interesting! We got to learn a lot about different animals we saw including elephants of course. The safari was a highlight! We also joined him for their very own lorry tour they offer at the hotel! That was super fun.

Overall, we cannot say enough good things about the hotel, their extremely nice staff, the good food, drinks and amenities. We would recommend to stay a few days to really get to experience it. Thank you again to Ravi for making our stay incredible and we hope to come back again one day.
title: Dreamy stay with incredible staff
